result.name: housing-led-population-projections
result.notes:
The housing-led projections reconcile future population growth with available housing supply by incorporating a housing supply trajectory. The housing-led projections are recommended for most local planning purposes, and the 10-year variant can be considered the default variant.

Users in London local authorities are able to request bespoke projections based on alternative housing scenarios through the [GLA Population Projection Service](https://data.london.gov.uk/dataset/gla-population-projection-service).

The most recent set of projections are the 2022-based round (August 2024) which comprise three variants based on different migration and fertility assumptions.

All 2022-based projections are based on a common scenario of assumed future housing delivery that is derived from capacity identified in the [2017 Strategic Housing Land Availability Assessment](https://www.london.gov.uk/programmes-strategies/planning/london-plan/new-london-plan/strategic-housing-land-availability-assessment).

These projections are based on modelled back series of population estimates produced by the GLA and available [here](https://data.london.gov.uk/dataset/modelled-population-backseries).

Additional documentation, including updated information about methodologies and assumptions will be published in the coming days.

For more information about these projections, see the accompanying [blog post](https://data.london.gov.uk/blog/gla-2022-based-population-projections/).

The housing-led projections include projections for London Boroughs and London wards (2022 boundaries). The release also includes components of change (births, deaths and migration data).

[Documentation page](https://data.london.gov.uk/dataset/population-projections-documentation)

[Back to projections homepage](https://data.london.gov.uk/demography/population-and-household-projections/)
result.title: Housing-led population projections

resources.description: Summary profiles of the 2021-based housing-led projections for each of London's 679 wards
resources.name: 2021-based projections: Ward Profiles

resources.description: 2021-based Interim GLA housing-led population projections for London boroughs and wards (2022 boundaries). 10-year migration trend constrained at the NUTS2 level to the GLA 10-year trend projection. Identified Capacity housing development scenario.
resources.name: 2021-based Identified Capacity 10-year migration. Borough and ward projection.

resources.description: 2021-based Interim GLA housing-led population projections for London boroughs and wards (2022 boundaries). 10-year migration trend constrained at the NUTS2 level to the GLA 10-year trend projection. Housing Targets housing development scenario.
resources.name: 2021-based Housing Targets 10-year migration

resources.description: 2021-based Interim GLA housing-led population projections for London boroughs and wards (2022 boundaries). 10-year migration trend constrained at the NUTS2 level to the GLA 10-year trend projection. Past Delivery housing development scenario.
resources.name: 2021-based Past Delivery 10-year migration

resources.description: A report summarising the results of the 2021-based projections.
resources.name: 2021-based Interim Projections Results

resources.description:
2022-based housing-led population projections for London boroughs and electoral wards (2022 boundaries).

Projection based on:

*   5-year period of local migration flows with ward results constrained to match the results of the GLA 5-year trend-based projection for ITL2 subregions.
*   _Low_ fertility scenario
*   Identified Capacity housing delivery scenario derived from the 2017 Strategic Housing Land Availability Assessment
resources.name: 2022-based 5-year migration Low Fertility Identified Capacity

resources.description:
2022-based housing-led population projections for London boroughs and electoral wards (2022 boundaries).

Projection based on:

*   10-year period of local migration flows with ward results constrained to match the results of the GLA 10-year trend-based projection for ITL2 subregions.
*   _Central_ fertility scenario
*   Identified Capacity housing delivery scenario derived from the 2017 Strategic Housing Land Availability Assessment
resources.name: 2022-based 10-year migration Central Fertility Identified Capacity

resources.description:
2022-based housing-led population projections for London boroughs and electoral wards (2022 boundaries).

Projection based on:

*   11-year period of local migration flows with ward results constrained to match the results of the GLA 15-year trend-based projection for ITL2 subregions.
*   _High_ fertility scenario
*   Identified Capacity housing delivery scenario derived from the 2017 Strategic Housing Land Availability Assessment
resources.name: 2022-based 15-year migration High Fertility Identified Capacity

resources.description: A report summarising the London-level results of the 2022-based projections.
resources.name: 2022-based projection results.html
